item.title: Using type aliases to make code clearer with generics
item.description: When you use generic types in C#, it is sometimes hard to understand what the generic argument can represent. For example, what do the strings represent in Dictionary<string, string>? item.title: Computing code coverage for a .NET project
item.description: In an older post, I wrote about how to compute code coverage for a .NET Core project with Coverlet.
